pros: Professional relationship in a Christian environment, excellent staff development opportunities.

cons: Paid less with having higher degree than most any other place

pros: Great flexibility, time off accrual and personal relationships built
cons: Forced pay cuts, people that are higher up make the most but the people that work the hardest always get their pay cut due to "budget restrictions." They also want to overload us with work but not pay us for it. We promote higher education but having a degree does not benefit any staff member in their salaries.

pros: Job was available to be filled.
cons: Management was over-matched by the tasks.

pros: I originally got this job because I was under the impression that my hours would be flexible and management would be friendly.
cons: I worked here for 3 years and never once got a raise, my hours were cut near the end of my employment despite being in that department longer than any of the other student workers or even my boss. During the 3 years I worked there I had 3 different managers, which got worse as they went on. Management hired people they were friends with and not people that actually knew what they were doing. When I quit, my boss tried to tell me I was legally not allowed to quit because of a contract. I never signed a contract and upon asking her for proof of the contract she realized she was wrong and let me quit, but not yelling at me in front of several students in the middle of working hours.

review_title: Overworked, Under appreciated, and under paid. Love the people, unhappy with the institution.
pros: The school has a family-like atmosphere and reliable people. It comes with all of the perks of working on a college campus, like cafeteria, athletic facilities, library, etc.
cons: As a Christian University, ALL staff (regardless of personal religious beliefs) are forbidden to drink (on OR off campus). Anyone could come into your home, see a glass of wine, and your job could be in jeopardy.

job_title: Director of Compliance in Central, SC
pros: Great people and great structure. The work environment is pleasant and there is not a lot of micro managing. The campus is a true community.
cons: Overall, there seem to be no cons in working here. Sometimes the department seems a bit short staffed but that is the nature of D2 athletics.

job_title: Adjunct Professor of Economics in Boiling Springs, Barnwell, SC
pros: Students were awesome and helped to give a family atmosphere to the class.
cons: Management expected too much of professors and students.
Not a supporting place; values don't seem to overlap with Christian values much among certain key employees.
